 First off the link to D/L the official version is here
https://www.srslabs.com/store/store/download_hal.asp?
2nd Yes it can screw up your sound at least with windows 7 64 bit so I reccomend you use system restore right before installing make a restore point and you can always go back to it if it screws with your system.
3rd you can download the official version as of aug 8 2011 and just extract and right click and merge the SRS-HDAL.activLic.reg to make the app fully functional
before anyone pipes in. I am a computer tech with 20 yrs under my belt in almost all aspects of programming and hardware and this was my own personal experience. so :-P

GREAT! Thanks (again for caring) :>
To people with problems:
# If you have issues with sound, close all programs that actually use SOUND before Installing! (including, firefox, winamp, and especially SKYPE !)
# Note that after install you will need to choose your output AUDIO DEVICE (from the "options" panel in the SRS program). Select the first and then try to listen to some music or sound. If nothing sounds choose the second, third and so... till you hear sound.
# After doing everything correctly you WILL have issues with crappy software (like SKYPE) so configure them properly without the access of autoconfiguring the audio device ... OR ELSE ....

## IF THIS SOUNDS "BAD" OR WORSE THAN YOUR STOCK DRIVERS just Uninstall it and try to get the latest drivers for your audio card (don't trust windows's built-in driver and the windows update drivers, they are NOT yours and the most of them won't sound OK and won't play 5.1 4.1 7.1 etc)

### If you have a really LOW-END / cheap sound system, just install the previuos version -> SRS AUDIO SANDBOX 1.10 and that would be a better choice for you ####
